question: Algae are useful to man in a variety of ______.

Many species of ______, Laminaria and Sargassum are used as food.
Porphyra, Laminaria and ______ are marine algae used as food.
About ______ species of marine algae are used as food.
Certain brown and red algae produce large amounts of ______ (water holding substances).
Brown algae produce hydrocolloid called ______.
Red algae produce hydrocolloid called ______.
Hydrocolloids like algin and carrageen are used ______.
Agar is obtained from ______ and Gracilaria.
Agar is a commercial product used to grow ______.
Agar is also used in the preparation of ______ and jellies.
A unicellular alga rich in proteins used as food supplement is ______.
Chlorella is even used by ______ travellers as food supplement.
The algae are divided into three classes: Chlorophyceae, Phaeophyceae and ______.
Members of Chlorophyceae are commonly called ______ algae.
The plant body of green algae may be unicellular, colonial or ______.
Green algae are usually grass green due to chlorophyll a and ______.
The pigments in green algae are localised in definite ______.
Chloroplasts may be discoid, plate-like, reticulate, cup-shaped, spiral or ______-shaped.
Storage bodies in chloroplasts of green algae are called ______.
Pyrenoids contain protein besides ______.
Some green algae may store food in the form of ______ droplets.
Green algae have a rigid cell wall made of inner layer of cellulose and outer layer of ______.
Vegetative reproduction in green algae usually occurs by ______.
Asexual reproduction in green algae occurs via flagellated ______.
Zoospores are produced in specialized structures called ______.
Sexual reproduction in green algae shows variation in type and formation of ______ cells.
Sexual reproduction in green algae may be isogamous, anisogamous or ______.
Commonly found green algae include Chlamydomonas, Volvox, Ulothrix, Spirogyra and ______.

In different species, the chloroplast shape may be spiral, reticulate or ______-shaped.
Agar is used to grow microbes and in preparation of ______ and jellies.
Brown algae such as Laminaria produce the hydrocolloid ______.
Red algae such as Gracilaria produce the hydrocolloid ______.
Commercial hydrocolloid agar is extracted from Gelidium and ______.
Green algae usually have a rigid ______ wall.
The cell wall of green algae consists of cellulose and ______.
Flagellated zoospores are produced inside ______ during asexual reproduction.
Isogamous reproduction involves fusion of gametes ______ in size.
Anisogamous reproduction involves gametes of ______ sizes.
Oogamous reproduction involves a large, non-motile female gamete and a ______ male gamete.
Members of Chlorophyceae may be unicellular, ______ or filamentous.
Pigments in Chlorophyceae are localised in definite ______.
Pyrenoids, present in chloroplasts, contain protein and ______.
Green algae may store food as ______ droplets.
Some commonly found green algae are Chlamydomonas, Volvox, Ulothrix, Spirogyra and ______.
Zoospores are produced in structures called ______ during asexual reproduction.
Chlorella is used as food supplement because it is rich in ______.
